content.text:
Clinical case 28.
Symptoms: 67-year-old female expatriate in Cameroon with transient subcutaneous swellings (Calabar swellings), eosinophilia.
Task: Using the image(s) and symptoms, provide the most likely diagnosis and how to confirm it.

Symptoms: 67-year-old female expatriate in Cameroon with transient subcutaneous swellings (Calabar swellings), eosinophilia.

Diagnosis: Loiasis

Confirmation/Key evidence: Identification of sheathed Loa loa microfilariae in blood.

meta.symptoms: 67-year-old female expatriate in Cameroon with transient subcutaneous swellings (Calabar swellings), eosinophilia.
meta.confirmation: Identification of sheathed Loa loa microfilariae in blood.

content.text:
Clinical case 31.

Confirmation/Key evidence: Clinical presentation and IgM serology.

meta.symptoms: 6-year-old boy from Malawi with fever, cough, coryza, conjunctivitis, maculopapular rash.
meta.confirmation: Clinical presentation and IgM serology.

content.text:
Clinical case 09.
Symptoms: 16-year-old girl in Vietnam with fever, headache, myalgia, gum bleeding, macular rash, and thrombocytopenia.
Task: Using the image(s) and symptoms, provide the most likely diagnosis and how to confirm it.

Symptoms: 16-year-old girl in Vietnam with fever, headache, myalgia, gum bleeding, macular rash, and thrombocytopenia.

Diagnosis: Dengue

Confirmation/Key evidence: NS1 antigen, IgM/IgG serology, or PCR. Tourniquet test indicates capillary fragility.

meta.symptoms: 16-year-old girl in Vietnam with fever, headache, myalgia, gum bleeding, macular rash, and thrombocytopenia.
meta.confirmation: NS1 antigen, IgM/IgG serology, or PCR. Tourniquet test indicates capillary fragility.

meta.confirmation: Microscopic Agglutination Test (MAT).

content.text:
Clinical case 39.
Symptoms: 30-year-old male trader from China/Laos with persistent fever and parasitaemia despite treatment.

content.text:
Clinical case 24.
Symptoms: 14-year-old boy from rural Tanzania with sudden onset of non-progressive spastic paraparesis and ankle clonus.

Symptoms: 14-year-old boy from rural Tanzania with sudden onset of non-progressive spastic paraparesis and ankle clonus.

Confirmation/Key evidence: Clinical diagnosis based on symptoms and exclusive cassava diet.

meta.symptoms: 14-year-old boy from rural Tanzania with sudden onset of non-progressive spastic paraparesis and ankle clonus.
meta.confirmation: Clinical diagnosis based on symptoms and exclusive cassava diet.

content.text:
Clinical case 69.
Symptoms: 22-year-old man from Ethiopia with spastic paraparesis (difficulty walking) after drought-related diet of grasspea.
Task: Using the image(s) and symptoms, provide the most likely diagnosis and how to confirm it.

Symptoms: 22-year-old man from Ethiopia with spastic paraparesis (difficulty walking) after drought-related diet of grasspea.

Diagnosis: Neurolathyrism

Confirmation/Key evidence: Clinical diagnosis based on spastic paraparesis and history of excessive consumption of Lathyrus sativus (grasspea).

meta.symptoms: 22-year-old man from Ethiopia with spastic paraparesis (difficulty walking) after drought-related diet of grasspea.
meta.confirmation: Clinical diagnosis based on spastic paraparesis and history of excessive consumption of Lathyrus sativus (grasspea).

Confirmation/Key evidence: Serology: RPR/VDRL positive and TPHA/TPPA positive.

meta.symptoms: 21-year-old pregnant woman from The Gambia with generalized, non-itchy macular rash involving palms/soles.
meta.confirmation: Serology: RPR/VDRL positive and TPHA/TPPA positive.

meta.confirmation: Spinal radiograph showing paravertebral soft tissue mass and collapsed vertebra.

Clinical case 04.

meta.confirmation: Clinical diagnosis based on WHO criteria (Trichiasis, Corneal Opacity).

Clinical case 65.
Symptoms: 4-year-old girl from Bolivia with a dark-brown nodule on the toe with central ulceration (painful).

Symptoms: 4-year-old girl from Bolivia with a dark-brown nodule on the toe with central ulceration (painful).

Diagnosis: Tungiasis

Confirmation/Key evidence: Clinical appearance of nodule with central pore; microscopy of extruded contents showing flea parts/eggs.

meta.symptoms: 4-year-old girl from Bolivia with a dark-brown nodule on the toe with central ulceration (painful).
meta.confirmation: Clinical appearance of nodule with central pore; microscopy of extruded contents showing flea parts/eggs.

content.text:
Clinical case 06.
Symptoms: 36-year-old male returning from Botswana with a mobile, itchy, serpiginous subcutaneous mass (migratory swelling) on the chest and shoulder.
Task: Using the image(s) and symptoms, provide the most likely diagnosis and how to confirm it.

Symptoms: 36-year-old male returning from Botswana with a mobile, itchy, serpiginous subcutaneous mass (migratory swelling) on the chest and shoulder.

Diagnosis: Gnathostomiasis

Confirmation/Key evidence: Clinical presentation after eating raw fish. Worm (Gnathostoma spinigerum) identified after migrating out of nose.

meta.symptoms: 36-year-old male returning from Botswana with a mobile, itchy, serpiginous subcutaneous mass (migratory swelling) on the chest and shoulder.
meta.confirmation: Clinical presentation after eating raw fish. Worm (Gnathostoma spinigerum) identified after migrating out of nose.

content.text:
Clinical case 67.
Symptoms: 24-year-old woman from Peruvian Andes with fever, weight loss, abdominal pain, and eosinophilia.

Symptoms: 24-year-old woman from Peruvian Andes with fever, weight loss, abdominal pain, and eosinophilia.

Diagnosis: Fascioliasis

Confirmation/Key evidence: CT scan showing clustered hypodense hepatic lesions. Confirmed by Fas2 ELISA serology.

meta.symptoms: 24-year-old woman from Peruvian Andes with fever, weight loss, abdominal pain, and eosinophilia.
meta.confirmation: CT scan showing clustered hypodense hepatic lesions. Confirmed by Fas2 ELISA serology.

content.text:
Clinical case 64.
Symptoms: 40-year-old woman from Thailand with severe headache, history of eating raw snails/freshwater fish.

Diagnosis: Eosinophilic Meningitis (Angiostrongyliasis)

Confirmation/Key evidence: Lumbar puncture showing eosinophilic meningitis (42% eosinophils). Western blot confirmed Angiostrongylus cantonensis.

meta.symptoms: 40-year-old woman from Thailand with severe headache, history of eating raw snails/freshwater fish.
meta.confirmation: Lumbar puncture showing eosinophilic meningitis (42% eosinophils). Western blot confirmed Angiostrongylus cantonensis.

content.text:
Clinical case 01.
Symptoms: 20-year-old woman from Sudan/Uganda presenting with fever, severe asthenia, chest and abdominal pain, nausea, vomiting, diarrhoea, gum bleeding, and shock.
Task: Using the image(s) and symptoms, provide the most likely diagnosis and how to confirm it.

Symptoms: 20-year-old woman from Sudan/Uganda presenting with fever, severe asthenia, chest and abdominal pain, nausea, vomiting, diarrhoea, gum bleeding, and shock.

Diagnosis: Ebola Haemorrhagic Fever

Confirmation/Key evidence: Confirmed by positive ELISA antigen and PCR for Ebola virus; negative for IgG antibody initially.

meta.symptoms: 20-year-old woman from Sudan/Uganda presenting with fever, severe asthenia, chest and abdominal pain, nausea, vomiting, diarrhoea, gum bleeding, and shock.
meta.confirmation: Confirmed by positive ELISA antigen and PCR for Ebola virus; negative for IgG antibody initially.

Confirmation/Key evidence: fdg-PET scan showing uptake; ELISA positive for Paragonimus westermani; Chest X-ray/CT.

meta.symptoms: 71-year-old man from Japan with a nodular lung lesion and eosinophilia. History of eating raw boar meat.
meta.confirmation: fdg-PET scan showing uptake; ELISA positive for Paragonimus westermani; Chest X-ray/CT.

content.text:
Clinical case 47.
Symptoms: 32-year-old man from Malawi with worsening cervical lymphadenitis after starting ART.

Symptoms: 32-year-old man from Malawi with worsening cervical lymphadenitis after starting ART.

Diagnosis: Immune Reconstitution Inflammatory Syndrome (IRIS) - TB

Confirmation/Key evidence: Paradoxical worsening despite effective therapy, coincident with immune recovery.

meta.symptoms: 32-year-old man from Malawi with worsening cervical lymphadenitis after starting ART.
meta.confirmation: Paradoxical worsening despite effective therapy, coincident with immune recovery.

content.text:
Clinical case 38.
Symptoms: 24-year-old female from Netherlands with focal seizures ('sensory march') and cystic brain lesions.
Task: Using the image(s) and symptoms, provide the most likely diagnosis and how to confirm it.

Symptoms: 24-year-old female from Netherlands with focal seizures ('sensory march') and cystic brain lesions.

Diagnosis: Neurocysticercosis

Confirmation/Key evidence: MRI showing cysts; EITB serology.

meta.symptoms: 24-year-old female from Netherlands with focal seizures ('sensory march') and cystic brain lesions.
meta.confirmation: MRI showing cysts; EITB serology.
